intro: Tillandsia juncifolia, commonly known as the silver vellum air plant, is a member of the Bromeliaceae family. It is an epiphytic plant that grows without soil, deriving moisture and nutrients from the air. Its leaves are long, narrow, and covered in a dense layer of white, woolly hair that helps it retain moisture. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white and yellow. It is native to Central and South America and is popular as a low-maintenance indoor plant.
